practiceScenarios.title: Board Meeting Participation
practiceScenarios.context: You're a board member concerned about a proposed merger. Present your objection formally.
practiceScenarios.task: Express opposition while maintaining professional decorum.
practiceScenarios.sampleResponse: Thank you, Chair. Before we proceed to a vote on this merger, I'd like to register several concerns. First, the due diligence report identifies significant integration risks that, in my view, have not been adequately addressed in management's presentation. Specifically, the cultural integration challenges with the target company suggest a longer timeline and higher costs than currently budgeted. Second, I question whether the projected synergies are realistic given comparable transactions in our industry. I would therefore move to defer this vote pending an independent assessment of the integration plan. Is there a second to this motion?

practiceScenarios.title: Regulatory Hearing
practiceScenarios.context: You're presenting your company's position at a regulatory hearing on proposed new requirements.
practiceScenarios.task: Argue against certain aspects of the proposal while showing willingness to comply.
practiceScenarios.sampleResponse: Good morning. I'm here to present our company's perspective on the proposed regulations. Let me begin by affirming our commitment to the underlying objectivesâ€”we share the agency's concern for consumer protection. However, we respectfully submit that certain provisions of the proposal would impose costs disproportionate to their benefits. Specifically, the reporting requirement in Section 4.3 would require investment in new systems that our analysis suggests would exceed $2 million annually, while achieving the same transparency goals as the less burdensome approach used in neighboring jurisdictions. We would urge the commission to consider adopting the alternative framework outlined in our written submission, which achieves compliance while permitting operational flexibility.
